ZUCLOPENTHIXOL DECANOATE

ANTIPSYCHOTIC DRUGS

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Important safety information
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Maintenance in schizophrenia and paranoid psychoses,

By deep intramuscular injection

  • For adults
    Test dose 100 mg, dose to be administered into the upper outer buttock or lateral thigh, followed by 200–500 mg after at least 7 days, then 200–500 mg every 1–4 weeks, adjusted according to response, higher doses of more than 500mg can be used; do not exceed 600 mg weekly.
  • For adults elderly
    A quarter to half usual starting dose to be used.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Extrapyramidal effects and withdrawal syndrome have been reported occasionally in the neonate when antipsychotic drugs are taken during the third trimester of pregnancy.

Following maternal use of antipsychotic drugs in the third trimester, neonates should be monitored for symptoms including agitation, hypertonia, hypotonia, tremor, drowsiness, feeding problems, and respiratory distress.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Can precipitate coma.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Start with small doses in severe renal impairment because of increased cerebral sensitivity.

Contra indications

  • Children
  • CNS depression
  • comatose states
  • phaeochromocytoma

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Erythema, nodules, pain at injection site, swelling,

If the dose needs to be reduced to alleviate side-effects, it is important to recognise that the plasma-drug concentration may not fall for some time after reducing the dose, therefore it may be a month or longer before side-effects subside.

Directions for administration

In general not more than 2–3 mL of oily injection should be administered at any one site.

Correct injection technique (including use of z-track technique) and rotation of injection sites are essential.

When initiating therapy with sustained-release preparations of conventional antipsychotics, patients should first be given a small test-dose as undesirable side-effects are prolonged.

Important safety information

When prescribing, dispensing, or administering, check that this is the correct preparation—this preparation is used for maintenance treatment and should not be used for the short-term management of an acute episode.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Avoid in Acute porphyrias
  • QT interval prolongation
  • when transferring from oral to depot therapy, the dose by mouth should be reduced gradually

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Treatment requires careful monitoring for optimum effect.

Prepared medicinal forms of ZUCLOPENTHIXOL DECANOATE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for injection
